Description: Square; incised "number" circles on sides painted red in circles.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Redpath Museum, Montreal. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Numerous solid six-sided (cubic) dice, predominantly of limestone with drilled pips (but also of faience, ivory, marble, pumice and terracotta) were found at Naukratis. Parallels known from the 7th century BC, but are particularly popular in the Roman period (Cool 2016, 229-231). This has been dated 'Roman', according to label. It is uncertain whether this is based on the common assumption that such dice are Roman (when they were most common) or whether that is based on the EEF context. Cool, H. E. M. 2016. The small finds and vessel glass from Insula VI.1 Pompeii: Excavations 1995-2006. Oxford: Archaeopress, Roman Archaeology 17.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TH.06)
